label: ham
subject: Re: [R] search path question
body: 171 (return) [ The Acts of the Passion of St. Boniface, which abound in miracles and declamation, are published by Ruinart, (p. 283Ñ291,) both in Greek and Latin, from the authority of very ancient manuscripts. Note: We are ignorant whether Aglae and Boniface were Christians at the time of their unlawful connection. See Tillemont. Mem, Eccles. Note on the Persecution of Domitian, tom. v. note 82. M. de Tillemont proves also that the history is doubtful.ÑG. ÑÑSir D. Dalrymple (Lord Hailes) calls the story of Aglae and Boniface as of equal authority with our _popular_ histories of Whittington and Hickathrift. Christian Antiquities, ii. 64.ÑM.]
